SEARCH
Package org.hibernate.search.engine.search.query.spi

Class AbstractSearchQuery<H,R extends SearchResult<H>>

java.lang.Object
org.hibernate.search.engine.search.query.spi.AbstractSearchQuery<H,R>
Type Parameters:
H - The type of query hits.
R - The result type (extending SearchResult).
All Implemented Interfaces:
SearchFetchable<H>, SearchQuery<H>, SearchQueryImplementor<H>
public abstract class AbstractSearchQuery<H,R extends SearchResult<H>> extends Object implements SearchQueryImplementor<H>
An abstract base for implementations of SearchQuery.

    Execute the query and return the SearchResult, limiting to limit hits.

    Execute the query and return the SearchResult, skipping offset hits and limiting to limit hits.

    Execute the query and return the SearchResult, including all hits, without any sort of limit.

    Execute the query and return all hits as a List, without any sort of limit.

    • fetchAll

      public R fetchAll()
      Description copied from interface: SearchFetchable
      Execute the query and return the SearchResult, including all hits, without any sort of limit.

      SearchFetchable.fetch(Integer) or SearchFetchable.fetch(Integer, Integer) should generally be preferred, for performance reasons.

      Specified by:
      fetchAll in interface SearchFetchable<H>
      Returns:
      The SearchResult.

      Description copied from interface: SearchFetchable
      Execute the query and return the SearchResult, limiting to limit hits.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • fetch

      public abstract R fetch(Integer offset, Integer limit)
      Description copied from interface: SearchFetchable
      Execute the query and return the SearchResult, skipping offset hits and limiting to limit hits.
      Specified by:
      fetch in interface SearchFetchable<H>
      Parameters:
      offset - The number of hits to skip before adding the hits to the SearchResult. null means no offset.
      limit - The maximum number of hits to be included in the SearchResult. null means no limit.
      Returns:
      The SearchResult.

    • fetchAllHits

      public List<H> fetchAllHits()
      Description copied from interface: SearchFetchable
      Execute the query and return all hits as a List, without any sort of limit.

      SearchFetchable.fetchHits(Integer) or SearchFetchable.fetchHits(Integer, Integer) should generally be preferred, for performance reasons.

      Specified by:
      fetchAllHits in interface SearchFetchable<H>
      Returns:
      The query hits.

    • fetchHits

      public List<H> fetchHits(Integer limit)
      Description copied from interface: SearchFetchable
      Execute the query and return the hits as a List, limiting to limit hits.
      Specified by:
      fetchHits in interface SearchFetchable<H>
      Parameters:
      limit - The maximum number of hits to be returned by this method. null means no limit.
      Returns:
      The query hits.

      Description copied from interface: SearchFetchable
